meanings.definition: To decorate excessively or too elaborately.
meanings.sent1: She kept overdecorating the cake with so many sprinkles that it became a colorful mess.
meanings.sent2: The interior designer warned against overdecorating the small living room to avoid making it feel cramped.
meanings.sent3: After overdecorating the classroom for the party, the teacher realized the students had no space to move around.
meanings.sent4: Her tendency to overdecorate her outfits with too many accessories made her stand out in a crowd.
meanings.sent5: The bride's mother insisted on overdecorating the wedding venue with flowers of every color imaginable.

meanings.definition: The act of adding too many decorations to something.
meanings.sent1: The overdecorating of the Christmas tree with countless ornaments made it difficult to see the lights.
meanings.sent2: The overdecorating of the office for the holiday party created a festive atmosphere for the employees.
meanings.sent3: The overdecorating of the birthday cake with candles caused it to collapse under the weight.
meanings.sent4: The overdecorating of the garden with gnomes and statues made it look like a magical wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The overdecorating of the classroom for the school play transformed it into a whimsical stage.
